1.text: Pour acetone or non-acetone polish remover into a small glass.

2.text: Dip the detail brush bristles into the remover and swish it for 10 to 20 seconds.
2.vid: /8/8b/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Blot the brush bristles on a paper towel or cotton pad.
3.vid: /5/5d/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Brush cuticle oil onto the bristles to condition them.
4.vid: /9/9b/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 4.360p.mp4

5.text: Soak a cotton pad in isopropyl alcohol.
5.vid: /b/b5/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 5.360p.mp4

6.text: Wipe both sides of the gel brush on the pad after painting a few nails.
6.vid: /9/97/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 6.360p.mp4

7.text: Wipe the handle of the brush with a soaked pad to remove stickiness.
7.vid: /2/28/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 7.360p.mp4

8.text: Swish the bristles in isopropyl alcohol to deep clean your brushes once a day.
8.vid: /1/12/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 8.360p.mp4

9.text: Put the cap on each brush before you store it horizontally.

10.text: Pour monomer into a small dish.

11.text: Saturate the bristles in monomer and wipe the brush on a cotton pad.
11.vid: /0/01/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 11.360p.mp4

12.text: Dip the bristles in acetone briefly if acrylic has cured in the bristles.
12.vid: /1/16/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 12.360p.mp4

13.text: Wipe the bristles on a lint-free cloth to shape them.
13.vid: /4/41/Clean Nail Art Brushes After Use Step 13.360p.mp4

14.text: Put the cap on the brush before you store it to protect the bristles.
